alert.note: Alert for Custer; Northern Big Horn; Northern Rosebud; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 9:43PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Big Horn, western Custer, northwestern Powder River, Rosebud and southeastern Treasure Counties through 1030 PM MDT... At 942 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Forsyth to Colstrip to near Busby. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Miles City, Colstrip, Forsyth, Lame Deer, Busby, Ashland, Rosebud, Birney, Cartersville, Birney Village, Hathaway, Vananda, Brandenberg, Muddy Cluster, Garland, Moon Creek Ranch and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Custer; Northern Big Horn; Northern Rosebud; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud; Treasure
